channel.title: CFA IDEV JIRA
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

description.p: In ServicePoint 2017 R4, iPOS Hold functionality is enhanced by allowing Deferred Orders to be put on Hold and stored in the Store/Recall queue.
In prior ServicePoint releases, Deferred Orders could not be held and stored in this fashion.

Preconditions:
iPOS and Mobile ordering configured for the Lab in use. No additional configuration is needed.

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

step.result: Orders are submitted and are now in the Mobile order deferred order queue

step.step: Sign into an iPOS or POS Next tablet with a Receipt type of Receipt-DT-iPOS
step.result: User is signed in

step.step: Recall one of the orders from the Mobile order queue
step.result: The order is recalled and the correct items are on the order

step.step: Tap the Hold button.
step.result: The order is placed on Hold and the hold button displays on the roof bar with a 1.

step.step: Tap the Hold button on the roof bar. Tap Yes to the prompt to store.
step.result: The mobile order is stored in the store recall queue

step.step: Verify the KPS displays the order correctly with the Mobile Header and correct items. Also Verify that the order is in the recall queue by navigating to Other functions>Recall By transaction number.
step.result: The order is displayed correctly and is in the recall queue

step.step: Recall the next mobile order and place it on hold, Create another normal order and store the order
step.result: The mobile held order is stored first then the second order. Confirmable on the KPS and in the recall queue

step.step: Recall the next Mobile order and place it on hold. Enter and place a standard order on hold. Press the hold button on the roof bar.
step.result: Both orders are stored, Mobile order first then Standard order

step.step: Recall the next Mobile order, Place the order on hold. Attempt to sign out.
step.result: Sign out is blocked because there is an order on hold

step.step: Swipe a manager card on a connected payment terminal.
step.result: User sign out is blocked because of the order on hold

step.step: Recall the last mobile order and place it on hold as well.
step.result: There are now two orders on hold

step.step: Begin and store a standard deferred order.
step.result: Storing the deferred order does not store the held orders.

step.step: Tap the hold button on the roof bar.
step.result: Both mobile orders are stored and displayed on the KPS

step.step: Recall the standard deferred order and place it on hold.
step.result: The deferred order is placed on hold.

step.step: Store a standard order.
step.result: The deferred order and standard order are stored.

item.title: [QLSP-324] iPOS-Disable cash drawer functionality if receipt printer switch is off

description.p: Disable cash drawer functionality if receipt printer switch is off is an enhancement for R4 2017. There is no BRS, therefore, this test is written on knowledge of prior iPOS experience and WIT 423737.
This test case covers the verification of new functionality added for this enhancement, denoted by the f in the title.

WIT Description: Prevent cash drawer functionality if the receipt printer toggle switch under iPOS Setup is turned off. Cash drawer relies on the printer connection for functionality, so without the printer switch on, cash drawer should never work.

ul.li: Disabling the receipt printer disables the switch for cash drawer and disables all functionality for the cash drawer
Cash drawer can not be enabled while receipt printer is not enabled
Receipt printer can or cannot be disabled/enabled while the user is signed in?
Re-enable receipt printer? Does it auto re-enable the cash drawer? The assumption is no.
Cash drawer and receipt printer connectivity - Loss of connection, reconnect, pair when enabled,

description.p:
Preconditions:
Epson TM88V Paired to the iPad. Cash drawer plugged into the connected receipt printer. All setup switches are disabled.

item.summary: iPOS-Disable cash drawer functionality if receipt printer switch is off

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

step.step: Open the iPOS setup page
step.result: Page is opened and all settings switches are disabled

step.step: Attempt to toggle the cash drawer switch
step.result: Switch cannot be toggled while print receipts is disabled

step.step: Toggle Print Receipts on
step.result: Print receipts is enabled and the receipt printer is recognized

step.step: Toggle Use cash drawer on
step.result: Cash drawer is enabled

step.step: Toggle Print Receipts off
step.result: Print receipts and cash drawer are both disabled

step.step: Toggle Print receipts and Use cash drawer back on then sign into iPOS
step.result: User is signed in

step.step: Enter any item and tender the transaction with a cash tender type
step.result: Cash drawer is opened and receipt is printed

step.step: Attempt to begin a transaction without closing the cash drawer
step.result: Attempt is blocked by and error message to close the cash drawer

step.step: Close the cash drawer
Attempt to toggle Print receipts off
step.result: Attempt is blocked because the cash drawer cannot be toggled while a user is signed in

description.p: This test will cover the enhancement for iPOS to validate deferred order promised times as the POS does today. This enhancement will not allow deferred orders for days when the store is closed such as Sunday.
Preconditions:
The lab in use should have its business unit set to be closed in EP (under business unit then days closed) for the next major holiday of the year. E.G. Thanksgiving/Christmas

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

step.step: Sign into iPOS
step.result: iPOS is signed in

step.step: Begin a deferred order for pickup
step.result: Pickup deferred order is started

step.step: Enter any item
step.result: Item is entered

step.step: Begin to store the deferred order
step.result: Deferred order frame is displayed

step.step: Enter the date for the next Sunday, Tap the guest name field
step.result: The date is validated when leaving the date entry field, modal displays stating that the store will be closed on that date prompt if that:"Verify the “<Date> is not a valid date. The restaurant is scheduled to be closed. Do you want to continue?” Yes and No Buttons are on the frame.

step.step: Tap Yes
step.result: The day is kept as the entered date

step.step: Enter a guest name, Store the order
step.result: Order is stored

step.step: Recall the same order, Change the date to the next holiday. (configured in EP) Tap off the field
step.result: Date is not valid and the modal is displayed

step.step: Tap No
step.result: Date is reverted back to Sunday

step.step: Tap Store
step.result: Does validation rerun?

step.step: Repeat steps 2-4, Enter a valid date, Store the order
step.result: No error message occurs

step.step: Check a delivery address for checking both the date and no address info
step.result: Error displays for date then error displays for address

item.title: [QLSP-286] iPOS - Disable cash drawer functionality if receipt printer switch is off

description.p: Disable cash drawer functionality if receipt printer switch is off is an enhancement for R4 2017. There is no BRS, therefore, this test is written on knowledge of prior iPOS experience and WIT 423737.
This test case covers the verification of new functionality added for this enhancement, denoted by the f in the title.

WIT Description: Prevent cash drawer functionality if the receipt printer toggle switch under iPOS Setup is turned off. Cash drawer relies on the printer connection for functionality, so without the printer switch on, cash drawer should never work.

Functionality to be verified:
Disabling the receipt printer disables the switch for cash drawer and disables all functionality for the cash drawer
Cash drawer can not be enabled while receipt printer is not enabled
Receipt printer can or cannot be disabled/enabled while the user is signed in?

Re-enable receipt printer? Does it auto re-enable the cash drawer? The assumption is no.
Cash drawer and receipt printer connectivity - Loss of connection, reconnect, pair when enabled,
Cash drawer Status updates
Epson TM88V Paired to the iPad. Cash drawer plugged into the connected receipt printer. All setup switches are disabled.

step.result: Cash drawer is opened and receipt is printed

Attempt to toggle Print receipts off
step.result: Attempt is blocked because the cash drawer cannot be toggled while a user is signed in

description.p:
iPOS - Order Discounts
Test case to cover iPOS order discounts. Discounts include: DOC card, CFA ONE, Promo Free, Employee, DOC Temp, Police,

Configuration:
iPOS

A test to cover the current state of credit functionality on iPOS
This test should be run with the e255 and e355 prior to release to the field.
This test case is valid until EMV is implemented on iPOS
Configuration:
iPOS should be paired to either an e255 or e355
iPOS should be paired to a receipt printer with connected cash drawer
User should be signed in

step.step: Enter any menu item, Tap tender, Tap credit, Swipe a credit card
step.data: Run this Step for each card type. Visa, Master Card, Discover, and American Express4
step.result: Transactions are finalized and the receipts are printed with the correct credit information.

step.step: Enter any menu item, Swipe a credit card, Tap store, Check KPS for Prepay flag, Recall on a POS and tender with the Use Customer Prepay button
step.data: Run this Step for two of the credit card types. Visa, Master Card, Discover, or American Express2
step.result: Transactions are finalized and the receipts are printed with the correct credit information.

step.step: Enter any menu item, Swipe a credit card, Tap store, Check KPS for Prepay flag, Recall on iPOS and tender with the Use Customer Prepay button
step.data: Run this Step for two of the credit card types. Visa, Master Card, Discover, or American Express2
step.result: Transactions are finalized and the receipts are printed with the correct credit information.

step.step: Enter enough menu items to amount to a transaction over $40, Tap tender, Swipe a credit card with a $35 limit, Complete the transaction with cash.
step.data: This step is difficult to produce sometimes as we do not know which cards have a $35 limit at any given time. If no card is found produce with a gift card.
step.result: Transaction is finalized and the receipt is printed with the correct credit information.

step.step: Enter any menu items so that the transaction is at least $20, Tap Tender, Tap $10 Cash button, Complete the transaction by swiping a credit card.
step.result: Transaction is finalized and the receipt is printed with the correct credit information.

step.step: Begin a deferred order, Enter a number of catering menu items, Tap Other Functions, Tap Store deferred order, Enter a Guest name, when Prompted for Credit Prepay, Manually enter the credit card number, Recall and tender on POS
step.result: Order is stored successfully with credit prepay from iPOS. Order is successfully tendered on POS.

step.step: Enter any menu item, Tap the Pay icon,Use a phone to tap an NFC payment, Tender the order with the captured NFC prepay.
step.data: Repeat this step for all payment types that are readily available. Apple Pay, Android Pay, Samsung Pay Currently available at the time of this write up.
step.result: Transactions are finalized and the receipts are printed with the correct credit information.

step.step: Navigate to premiums, Tap CFA card, Tap Balance Inquiry, Swipe a Gift Card.
step.result: The Balance of the Gift card is displayed

step.step: Tap Go Back, depending on the result from the previous test step, reload the gift card on the POS so that it has more than $100 on it.
step.data: Must reload on POS as iPOS does not support Gift card activations or reloads
step.result: Gift card is reloaded

step.step: Enter any menu item, Swipe a Prepay with the reloaded gift card, Store the order, Check KPS for Prepay flag, Recall and tender on iPOS
step.data: Repeat this step and recall on the POS as well.
step.result: Transaction is finalized and the receipt is printed with the correct gift card information Including the remaining balance.

step.step: Enter any menu item, Scan a mobile account with pay funds, Store the transaction, Recall and tender on iPOS
step.data: Repeat this step and recall on the POS as well.
step.result: Transaction is finalized and the receipt is printed with the correct credit information.

step.step: Enter any menu item, Swipe a valid DOC, perform a DOC inquiry, enter a item for a valid DOC offer, Tap Tender, Swipe a credit card.
step.data: Run for one of the card types.
step.result: DOC offer is applied, Transaction is finalized and the receipt is printed with the DOC card info and credit card information.

description.p: Test of the new contest tracking options to ensure iPOS sends CFA One entries correctly to be counted.

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

attachment.name: Add CFA One Entries to Contests.docx
attachment.author: grant.parker

step.step: Setup a collaborative CFA One contest for 10 CFA One entries.
step.data: Reference the attached BRS for setup instructions.
step.result: Contest is setup

step.step: Enter and tender an order a CFA One scan on iPOS
step.result: Order is complete and 1 order is displayed in the contest bar on the POS.

step.step: Enter and store an order with CFA one scan on iPOS and recall and tender the order on POS
step.result: Order is complete and 2 orders are displayed in the contest bar on the POS.

step.step: Enter and store an order with CFA one scan on iPOS and recall and tender the order on iPOS
step.result: Order is complete 3 orders are displayed in the contest bar on the POS.

step.step: Enter an order on iPOS. Enter the CFA One card number manually under DOC entry. Tender the order.
step.result: Order is complete 4 orders are displayed in the contest bar on the POS.

step.step: Enter an order on iPOS. Swipe an AList card. Tender the order.
step.result: Order is complete 5 orders are displayed in the contest bar on the POS.

step.step: Enter a transaction with multiple DOC cards and a CFA One account
step.result: Order is complete 6 orders are displayed in the contest bar on the POS.

step.step: Complete 5 more orders on iPOS that include CFA One
step.result: Each order completion adds to the contest amount. 11 total contests are completed and the goal is accomplished.

step.step: End the contest. Pull a contest report for the exact time that testing occurred between.
step.result: The 11 contests are reported. All 11 are credited to the cashier signed into iPOS.

step.step: Start another contest for individual.Repeat steps 2-9.
step.data: POS will not update contest because it is not the user signed in. The contest report will reflect the 11 orders for the individual.
step.result: The 11 contests are reported. All 11 are credited to the cashier signed into iPOS.

step.step: Start another contest for team. Add the user from the POS and iPOS to theRepeat steps 2-9.
step.result: The 11 contests are reported. All 11 are credited to the cashier signed into iPOS.

item.title: [QLSP-208] iPOS - Cash Drawer status is not checked if the same item is used after drawer is opened

description.p:
iPOS - Cash Drawer status is not checked if the same item is used after drawer is opened
Defect:
Steps to reproduce:

ul.li: Add a Fries Lg, press tender,
Finalize the tran with exact $ for cash drawer to open
Start another transaction using the same item (Fries Lg)

description.p: Cash Drawer status is not checked and transaction is allowed to start.
NOTE: If using the same item again the "Close drawer to start message" displays

item.summary: iPOS - Cash Drawer status is not checked if the same item is used after drawer is opened

status.description: This issue was once resolved, but the resolution was deemed incorrect. From here issues are either marked assigned or resolved.

step.step: Sign into a tender enabled iPOS
step.data: T88V and cash drawer should be available
step.result: User is sign in

step.step: Add a Large Fry to the order
step.result: Large fry is added

step.step: Tender the order and finalize with Exact dollar
step.result: Transaction is finalized and cash drawer is opened

step.step: With cash drawer remaining open, Add a Large fry to a transaction
step.result: Addition is blocked by please close cash drawer

step.step: Close the cash drawer, attempt add a Large fry again
step.result: Fry is added to the transaction

item.title: [QLSP-113] iPOS - Suspend local tax file update
item.summary: iPOS - Suspend local tax file update

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

step.step: ConfigEnable External Tax config.Work with Tax team to find a store with Fees
Enter a #1 with a Sweet Tea on the order
step.result: Order is entered and no tax is calculated

step.step: Tap Store
step.result: Fees and Taxes are visually calculated.

step.step: Check the Request and response files on the server
step.result: Check that the request is sending the correct item information.Check that the response contains Fee information for PIF and RSFEnsure that the Fee is added to the total taxable amount and then the Tax is calculated.

step.step: Recall the order on iPOSTender the order
step.result: Check the TLD for Fee information the fields will be under<NAME>Fee</NAME> then check theValue field for PIF and RSFCheck the printed receipt for the Fee information. This is the total fee amount and not the lineitem fee.

step.step: Create a transaction with a Mediumnugget trayTap manage functionsTap No TaxStore the order
step.result: Fees are not calculated. No Tax is added to the order. Verify in the Request and response and TLD

step.step: Check that in the TLD the Total Tax for each line item includes the PIF and RSF amounts
step.result: Total is calculated correctly.

step.step: On an iPOS that is configured with the External tax receipt type, Begin a transaction with any item.Tap Get Tax/Offers
step.result: System calculates tax and fee information

step.step: Add an item to the transactionHold the order.
step.result: Does the Fee calculation get updated or removed?Holding the order retains the tax and fee amount.

step.step: Enter a non taxable item from local items.
step.result: Are fees calculated?

step.step: Taxable item with non taxable item
Promo free alone and with item
Cost condiments on a sandwich
Gift card sale
DOC transaction
Seat TotalHow is the fee split between seats?
Mobile order tender how are fees handled?
Enter a large multi item transactionEnsure that the fees are calculated correctly

step.result: Tap to pay is successful

item.summary: iPOS - Capture and pass CFA GUID in TLD

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

step.result: Mobile accounts are created.

step.step: Enter an order on iPOS and scan the first mobile account.Store the order
step.result: Order is stored.

step.step: Recall the order on iPOS and tenderRecord the transaction number.Look up the transaction in SSUI to review the TLD dataSearch the TLD for the field <external_customer_id>Record the CFA-ID for the account scanned
step.result: CFA ID is present in the external customer id feild.

step.step: Enter another transactionScan a second mobile account and tender itdirectlyUse the same process as step 2 to find the CFAGUID
step.result: CFA GUID is recorded for the second mobile account

step.step: Enter another transactionEnter the third mobile accountStore the orderRecall the order on the POS and tenderCollect the CFA GUID from the TLD for the third mobile account
step.result: All Actions are successful

step.step: Enter a transaction on POSScan account number four Recall the transaction on iPOSTender the transactionCollect the CFA GUID from the TLD for the fourth mobile account
Scan the Third mobile account then the first mobile account on a transactionTender the transactionView the TLD and verify that only the Third mobile account GUID is recorded in the TLD
step.result: Only the third GUID is reported in the file.

step.step: Begin a transaction scan mobile account four on iPOSStore the orderRecall the orderScan mobile account 3Tender the transaction
step.result: Only the fourth Mobile account GUID is in the TLD

step.step: Check in supportal to confirm that the all 4 GUIDs are correct
Begin a transaction on iPOSTap Store - Guest info frame displaysScan a mobile accountComplete the store process.Recall and tender the order on POSDoes this pull the GUID into the TLD?
Begin a transaction on iPOSTap Store - Guest info frame displaysScan a mobile accountComplete the store process.Recall and tender the order on iPOSDoes this pull the GUID into the TLD?
Begin a transaction on iPOSSwipe a Standard DOC - UnregisteredScan a mobile accountTender the transaction
step.result: Is the GUID from the mobile account included?

step.step: Begin a transaction on iPOSSwipe a CalenderDOCScan a mobile accountTender the transaction
step.result: Is the GUID from the mobile account included?

step.step: Begin a transactionEnter one of the accountsRemove the DOC with DOC remover under PremiumsTender the Order
step.result: Does the GUID still get passed? It should be removed.

step.step: Begin a transactionEnter one of the accounts - Note the associated GUIDRemove the Account with DOC removalEnter an different accountTender the transaction
step.result: Which GUID is passed?

item.title: [QLSP-65] iPOS - Accept DOC on guest info screen indepth
item.summary: iPOS - Accept DOC on guest info screen indepth

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

step.step: No transaction is in progress;Team member selects the Guest Info function;System displays the Guest Info Frame;Team member swipes/scans DOC1;System displays the No Transaction In Progress Error Message;Team member scans DOC2 and SVC1;System displays the No Transaction In Progress Error Message;System might display the No Transaction In Progress Error Message again (one time for DOC2 and one timefor SVC1);Team member selects the Finalize Entries button on the Guest Info Frame;If at least one guest info element had been selected/entered through the Guest Info Frame when the FinalizeEntries button was selected, the system would start the transaction;If no guest info element had been selected/entered through the Guest Info Frame when the Finalize Entriesbutton was selected, the system would not start the transaction.

Transaction is in progress (non-totaled) having DOC1, DOC2, DOC3, DOC4, DOC5 and DOC6associated with it;Team member selects the Guest Info function;System displays the Guest Info Frame;Team member swipes/scans DOC7;System validates DOC7 and associates DOC7 (A-List Card) with the transaction; Team member swipes/scans DOC1;System determines that DOC1 is already associated with the transaction;System displays the DOC Already In Transaction Error Message (see Figure 2) and ignores this lastcapture of DOC1;Team member swipes/scans DOC7;System determines that DOC7 is already associated with the transaction;System displays the DOC Already In Transaction Error Message (see Figure 2) and ignores this lastcapture of DOC7;Team member swipes/scans DOC8;System validates DOC8 and associates DOC8 (Calendar Card) with the transaction;Team member scans DOC9 and SVC1;System determines that the maximum number of DOCs allowed per transaction (8) has already beenreached;System displays the Maximum Number of DOCs Reached Error Message (see Figure 3) and ignores thecapture of DOC9 (SVC1 is validated and processed accordingly);Team member swipes/scans DOC10;System determines that the maximum number of DOCs allowed per transaction (8) has already beenreached;System displays the Maximum Number of DOCs Reached Error Message (see Figure 3) and ignores thecapture of DOC10;Team member selects the Finalize Entries button on the Guest Info Frame;System closes the Guest Info Frame.

Transaction is started;System displays the Guest Info Frame (configured auto prompt);Team member swipes/scans DOC1;System validates DOC1 and associates DOC1 (Calendar Card) with the transaction;Team member scans DOC2 and SVC1;System validates DOC2 and associates DOC2 (A-List Card) with the transaction (SVC1 is validated andprocessed accordingly);Team member selects the Finalize Entries button or the Skip button on the Guest Info Frame;System closes the Guest Info Frame.

Transaction is in progress (not totaled) with no DOCs;Transaction is requested to be stored;System displays Vehicle Description Frame (configured auto prompt);Team Member selects the Guest Info button on the Vehicle Description Frame;System displays the Guest Info Frame;Team member swipes/scans DOC1;System validates DOC1 and associates DOC1 (A-List Card) with the transaction;Team member scans DOC2 and SVC1;System validates DOC2 and associates DOC2 (A-List Card) with the transaction (SVC1 is validated and processed accordingly);Team member selects the Finalize Entries button (saves selected/entered guest info data) or the Skip button (does not save selected/entered guest info data) on the Guest Info Frame;System closes the Guest Info Frame;System returns to the Vehicle Description Frame;Team Member selects the Guest Info button on the Vehicle Description Frame;System displays the Guest Info Frame;Team member scans DOC3 and SVC2;System validates DOC3 and associates DOC3 (A-List Card) with the transaction (SVC2 is validated and processed accordingly);Team member selects the Finalize Entries button (saves selected/entered guest info data) or the Skip button (does not save selected/entered guest info data) on the Guest Info Frame;System closes the Guest Info Frame;System returns to the Vehicle Description Frame;Team member selects the Done button (saves selected vehicle data) or the Cancel button (does not save selected vehicle data) on the Vehicle Description Frame;System closes the Vehicle Description Frame;System stores the transaction.

Transaction is in progress with no DOCs;Transaction is totaled;System displays the Guest Info Frame (configured auto prompt);Team member swipes/scans DOC1;System validates DOC1 and associates DOC1 (Calendar Card) with the transaction;Team member scans DOC2 and SVC1;System validates DOC2 and associates DOC2 (A-List Card) with the transaction (SVC1 is validated and processed accordingly);Team member selects the Finalize Entries button (saves selected/entered guest info data) or the Skip button (does not save selected/entered guest info data) on the Guest Info Frame;System closes the Guest Info Frame;System displays the InFORM Account Name Selection Frame (configured auto prompt);Team member selects an InFORM account and the Use Selected button on the InFORM Account Name Selection Frame;System closes the InFORM Account Name Selection Frame;System displays the Additional Account Information Frame;Team member selects the Done button on the Additional Account Information Frame (after entering data or not in the fields of that frame);System closes the Additional Account Information Frame;System displays the Tender Frame (see A_01).

item.title: [QLSP-61] iPOS - Emphasize Lowest Sequence Number on the KPS
item.summary: iPOS - Emphasize Lowest Sequence Number on the KPS

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

step.step: Configuration:At least one KPS should be configured for use.Additional will be added later.In SMW configure the color of the lowest sequenceunder the KPS color configuration to forground LightBlue and background PinkGenerate and Send filesSign into iPOS
step.result: User is signed in

step.step: Begin and store 10 transactions
step.result: S/R queue contains 10 orders, KPS displays orders with no sequence number

step.step: Tap Sequence
step.result: All 10 transactions are displayed in the sequence frame

step.step: Tap the Sequence button
step.result: KPS displays the transactions with sequence numbers. Sequence number 1 is highlighted.

step.step: Recall and tender Sequence #1
step.result: KPS shows the transaction as Tendered

step.step: Bump Sequence 1 from the KPS
step.result: Sequence 1 is removed and Sequence 2 is now highlighted as the lowest sequence number

step.step: Continue to tender and bump transactionsensuring that the highlighted sequence shifts to the next lowest until alltransactions are cleared.
step.result: KPS is blank. Sequence highlight changed as the lowest was bumped.

step.step: Repeat steps 2 and 3Resequence the transactions into a random order.
step.result: Transactions are resequenced, sequence numbers are added to all transactons on the KPS. Sequence 1 is highlighted.

step.step: Recall, tender, and bump transactions ensuring that the lowest sequence number continues to be highlightedthroughout bumps
step.result: KPS is clear.

step.step: Begin and store 11 transactions - at least one transaction is off of the KPSSequence the transactions so that the order off Screen is the lowest. Move the bottom order to the top of the list.
step.result: Sequence 2 is highlighted

step.step: Tender and bump the transaction with sequence 2
step.result: Sequence 1 is displayed on the KPS and is highlighted

step.step: Reconfigure the KPS in LHDevCfgto be split view with Grill routed to one view and Drive Thru to the other.Save, generate, and send files.
step.result: KPS now shows 2 views

step.step: Begin and store 11 orders
step.result: The KPS is filled with orders each view displays one off screen

step.step: Resequence the orders so that the order off screen is the lowest.
step.result: Sequence 2 is the lowest highlighted transaction

step.step: Bump Sequence 2 from the grill view.
step.result: Sequence 1 is the highlighted sequence for the grill and Sequence 2 remains highlighted on the DT view.

step.step: Bump Sequence 2 from the DT view.
step.result: Sequence 1 moves onto the DT view and is now the highlighted number for that view

step.step: In LHDev change the Spilt view back to normal and add a KPS for the Grill view. Set the DT KPS as the Master bumpterminal.Save, generate, and send files.
step.result: Two KPS monitors are available for use.

step.step: Begin and store 15 transaction
step.result: Transactions are submited and the KPS displays that there are transacions off screen

step.step: Tap SequenceSequence the transactions so that the orders ooff screen have the lowest sequence numbersTap the Sequence button
step.result: Both KPS displays are updated with the new Sequenceing order and the lowest number displayed is highlighted.

step.step: On the Grill KPS, bump the Lowest sequence number
step.result: The next lowest sequence number is highlighted.

step.step: On the Grill KPS, bump any transaction that is not highlighted on the KPS.
step.result: For the DT KPS, The previous lowest highlighted sequence is unhighlighted and the new lowest is highlighted.For the Grill KPS, The same transaction that was bumped on the DT KPS is removed and the highlighted sequence istransitioned if needed.

step.step: Bump transactions from the DT KPS so that the lowest sequence matches between KPS displays.Bump the lowest sequence from the DT KPS Order is also bumped from the Grill KPSRecall the order just bumped, add an item, and tender the order.
step.result: Order is redisplayed as a change order on both KPS displays and is re-highlighted as the lowest sequence.

step.step: Configure a view for Desertsonly and assign itto a split view or second KPSSave, generate, and download
step.result: Views are updated successfully

step.step: Bump the change order transaction from the DT KPS - Transaction is removed from both KPS DisplaysBump the next lowest Sequence from the DT KPS - Transaction is removed from both KPS DisplaysTap Recall on the bump bar
step.result: The Previously bumped order it recalled and is highlighted as the lowest sequence

step.step: Store 12 orders with alternating dessert and no dessert items
step.result: 12 items display on the DT KPS and 6 display on the dessert KPS

step.step: Sequence the transactions so that one of the transactions that is not currently displayed on the Non dessert KPS is the lowest sequence
step.result: The next lowest sequence is displayed on that KPS and the lowest is displayed on the Dessert KPS

step.step: Recall and tender all oreds from this test.Reset the KPS to the previous configuration.

item.title: [QLSP-60] iPOS - Use Exact Dollar Instead of Prepay with a Zero Balance
item.summary: iPOS - Use Exact Dollar Instead of Prepay with a Zero Balance

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

step.step: Configuration:Change the settings under site option override to Yes for the option Use Exact $ for Zero Balance Trans with PrepayGenerate and download filesRestart POS and iPOSSign into iPOS
step.result: User is signed in

step.step: Begin a transaction by adding an item that corresponds to a valid DOC offer.
step.result: Items is shown on the vitual receipt.

step.step: Select oneOption 1:Swipe the valid DOCSwipe a gift card.Option 2:Scan a Mobile Account with CFA One or Alist offer and Pay Balance.
step.result: Both a DOC XXXX and Prepay Gift/Credit displays on the Virtual ReceiptBoth should be tested.

step.step: Tap TenderEnsure that the DOC discount applies otherwise attempt a different card/item combo
step.result: The tender frame displays - Buttons are normal, Use Customer Prepay button is avalableTotal due is $0.00

step.step: Tap Use Customer Prepay
step.result: Order is processed with exact dollar because of the $0 amount

step.step: Repeat Steps 2-4Tender with Next Dollar
step.result: Order is submited with exact dollar

step.step: Change the site option override previously set to NoGenerate and send filesRestart POS and iPOSSign inot iPOS
step.result: User is signed in.

step.step: Repeat steps 2-4Tap Use Customer Prepay
step.result: An error displays: Amount to smallTap all other tender methods apart from exact dollar to ensure that the same error message displays.

step.step: Begin a transaction with a non DOC item and scan a cfa one account with mobile pay.Promo the item so there is a zero dollar balance.Tap use customer prepay.

step.result: Transaction is completed as expected

step.result: Transaction is completed as expected

item.title: [QLSP-35] iPOS CEM - CEM print frequency consistent between iPOS and POS

step.result: Both systems restart with out issue.

step.result: Both reciepts display the same information apart from Survey number.Note: The iPOS CEM receipt will display the resturant number under the iPOS settings. This is normal.

item.title: [QLSP-16] iPOS - R4 to R1 Key Chain settings transfer Negative

description.p: Negative and Edge tests for the R4 to R1 Keychain process.

item.summary: iPOS - R4 to R1 Key Chain settings transfer Negative

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

step.step: Uninstall R4 just before R1 install.
step.result: Does the data transfer?

step.step: Uninstall R4 after R1 install but before R1 open
step.result: Does data transfer?

step.step: Open and use R1.Close R1. Leave R4 installed and open and change settings in R4.Open R1
step.result: Is R1 impacted?

step.step: Change settings in R4 prior to R1 install.Do not close R4.Install R1.Open R1.
step.result: Which Settings are transferred to R1?

step.step: With R4 data saved, Open R1 with no network connectivity
step.result: Settings are still imported.

step.step: With R4 data saved, Add a terminal to the list for iPOS in LHDev before opening R1.Save and generate files.Open R1
step.result: No issues are caused by the new terminal

step.step: With R4 data saved, Remove the configured terminal from LHDev.Save and generate files.Open R1
step.result: Update is block because the terminal is invalid

step.step: With R4 data saved and a previous credit reader paired, install R1Pair a different credit reader.Open R1
step.result: R1 opens with out issue.

step.step: With R4 data saved, Open R1.Uninstall the R1 app.Reinstall R1.Open R1.
step.result: Do the setting repopulate?

step.step: When a new version of R1 is available, Install the new version of R1.
step.result: Changed setting are not overwritten and now issues occur.

item.title: [QLSP-15] iPOS - R4 to R1 Keychain settings transfer

description.p: R1 will require a new app and cannot be installed on top of R4. Therefore, functionality has been added in 2016 R4 to save all iPOS setting to the iOS Keychain. R1 will then import these values from the Keychain in the first run of iPOS.
High level Testing requirements:

ul.li: All data is correctly imported into R1
Changes made after the first run are not modified by code on a reboot
Clean install of R1 runs with out any import

item.summary: iPOS - R4 to R1 Keychain settings transfer

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

step.step: Install the latest available R4 2016 build (4079 and later)
step.result: Build installed

step.step: Configure R4 for the connected Lab/Store
step.data: Make a note of all settings
step.result: R4 is configured

step.step: Force close iPOS R4Open R4 and check logs for the Keychain save
step.result: Save was successful

step.step: Install R1
step.result: Install is successful

step.step: Open R1
step.result: On open all settings are imported

step.step: Perform an updateSign in
step.result: User is signed in

step.step: Sign out and change the terminal number and updateClose iPOSOpen iPOS
step.result: The terminal selected by the user remains selected.

step.step: On a separate iPad, Ensure that all versions of iPOS are uninstalled.
step.result: iPOS is not installed

step.step: Install R1 buildOpen iPOS
step.result: No settings are imported.

item.title: [ATP-209] iPOS - Direct calculation call to Sabrix

description.p: In 2017 R4 the enhancement "Tax-Sabrix Call from POS Terminal" has been added. This will directly impact iPOS as well.

item.summary: iPOS - Direct calculation call to Sabrix

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

description.p: A test to ensure that the Store Recall functions of iPOS are not impacted by Tax

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

step.step: Setup: Ensure that the iPOS terminal number in use is a part of a Store Recall group with a POS terminal in LHDevTax call set to external in EP.
step.result: Setup is complete.

step.step: Enter a transaction on iPOS. Calculate tax by tapping the Get Tax/Offers. Enter a prepay and store the order
step.result: Tax is calculated with button press and again at store

step.step: Enter and store a transaction from iPOS
step.result: Tax is calculated on store and displayed on the virtual receipt

step.step: Recall both transactions on a POS terminal and tender.
step.result: Transactions are recalled with the correct tax amount and finalized successfully

step.step: Create 4 seat order. Press the Get Tax/offers button
step.result: Tax is calculated correctly

step.step: Store the order.
step.result: Tax is calculated

step.step: Recall the seat on the POS and split seats 1 and 2 off for tender.
step.result: Seat 3 and 4 are stored back in the SR queue.Tax is calculated correctly for seat 1 and 2

step.step: Tender seat 1 and 2. Recall seat 3 and 4 and tender.
step.result: All seats are tendered with out issue.

step.step: Create a transaction and tap the hold button.
step.result: Order is placed on Hold. Tax is calculated and displayed on the virtual receipt.

step.step: Tap the hold icon on the Roof bar
step.result: Order is then placed in the Store/Recall queue

step.step: Recall the held order on the POS.Tender the order
step.result: Order is recalled and the information is correct.Transaction is completed.
